required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Fish Oil on Platelet Function and Coagulation
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Fish Oil on Platelet Function and Coagulation

brief_summary.textblock: Many patients undergoing surgery use naturopathic drugs, including fish oil. Fish oil has been reported to increase bleeding in patients through inhibiting platelet aggregation and prolonging of clot formation time. The Swedish Medical Products Agency recommends that patients stop taking the naturopathic medicines including fish oil two weeks prior planed surgery. The aim of this study is to examine the effects of fish oil given to healthy volunteers using point of care coagulation assessment and flow dependent Cellix instrument before and after intake of fish oil.

detailed_description.textblock: Healthy volunteers will be given maximum dose of fish oil for 7 days. Blood samples will be collected before and immediately after the 7 days of intake and analysed using point of care coagulation assessment instruments and flow dependent platelet aggregation using a microfluid flow controlled system (Cellix). For point of care coagulation assessment the multiple electrode platelet aggregometer Multiplate, the viscoelastic rotational thromboelastometers ROTEM and Sonoclot will be used. Flow cytometry may also be utilized.

primary_outcome.measure: Thrombocyte aggregation measured with multiple electrode aggregometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of thrombocyte aggregation directly after intake period of 7 days compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Multiple electrode aggregometry gives a area under the curve proportional to thrombocyte aggregation

primary_outcome.measure: Thrombocyte aggregation measured with Cellix's microfluidic pumps and biochips
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of thrombocyte aggregation directly after intake period of 7 days compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Cellix's microfluidic pumps and biochips gives an thrombosis area proportional to thrombocyte aggregation

secondary_outcome.measure: Coagulation measured with the viscohemostatic instrument ROTEM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of coagulation directly after intake period of 7 days compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Coagulation measured with the viscohemostatic instrument and Sonoclot
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change of coagulation directly after intake period of 7 days compared to baseline

arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers given maximum dose of fish oil for 10 days.

intervention.description: Blood samples before and after 10 day intake of maximum dose fish oil

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non smoking healthy volunteers with written consent to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medication affecting coagulation or platelets within 14 days priori to inclusion

overall_official.affiliation: Dept. of Clinical Sciences, Lund University, SWEDEN

facility.name: Intensive and perioperative care. Skåne University Hospital. Lund

results_reference.citation: Bagge A, Schött U, Kander T. Effects of naturopathic medicines on Multiplate and ROTEM: a prospective experimental pilot study in healthy volunteers. BMC Complement Altern Med. 2016 Feb 17;16:64. doi: 10.1186/s12906-016-1051-y.

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD will be available upon reasonable request
